meanings.definition: Perforated or porous, as in a cribrous bone.
meanings.sent1: The cribrous sponge soaked up all the water quickly.
meanings.sent2: The cribrous rock allowed water to flow through easily.
meanings.sent3: The cribrous bread was perfect for making a delicious sandwich.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a cribrous sieve, letting ideas flow in and out effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The cribrous fabric was so light and airy, it felt like wearing a cloud.

meanings.definition: Having small holes or openings, as in cribrous tissue.
meanings.sent1: The cribrous net caught all the fish in the pond.
meanings.sent2: The cribrous sponge absorbed the spilled milk in seconds.
meanings.sent3: The cribrous cheese was perfect for melting on top of a burger.
meanings.sent4: The cribrous clouds in the sky allowed glimpses of the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent5: The cribrous paper was so delicate, it tore easily with a gentle touch.
